p: In the atmosphere, the presence of clouds is estimated to enhance the shortwave absorption by 7 Wm −2 from 73 Wm −2 (Fig. 14 right), to 80 Wm −2 (Fig. 14 left). This is slightly higher than corresponding estimates obtained from most climate models and the CERES EBAF datasets, at 5 Wm −2 between 60°N and 60°S (Hakuba et al. 2016), and 4.1 Wm −2 globally (Kato et al. 2018).
